intro: Myosotis ambigens, commonly known as the ambiguous forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 15–30 centimeters. The plant features small, blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Myosotis ambigens is adapted to grow in damp, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream sides.
